metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3566 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libav-tools - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm4').
